result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest E Creech

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earnest E Creech appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing. Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earnest E Creech in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel. 
Court orders defendant to continue to comply with Justice Point conditions. Court reminds defendant that bail conditions remain in effect: no possession of dangerous weapons/firearms.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-9-2022

Defendant Earnest E Creech in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel due to a conflict is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion to Withdraw, Atty Romenesko
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated August 1, 2022 - received
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Earnest E Creech in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Earnest E Creech in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earnest E Creech appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
